description: Lemon juice mixed with water and sugar to dull the sourness.  Delicious and refreshing.
Consisting of a special blend of electrolytes and simple sugars, this beverage tastes like bottled sweat but rehydrates the body faster than water.
Sweetened coffee and whiskey topped with milk.  Start your day the closeted alcoholic way!
Like apple cider, only with vodka.
Well-aged honey wine, spiced with a hint of hops.  Goes down bittersweet.
A light and delicious wine made from dandelion flowers.  Slightly effervescent, it is smooth and crisp.
A potent wine flavored with pine resin.  Bold and pungent, its biting taste and strong aroma takes some getting used to.
Not the finest drink you've had, but hey, it's alcohol by the gallon.
Only the strongest, purest, good ol' fashioned hooch.  Guaranteed to make you forget about the whole cataclysm thing, or you get your vision back.
A tasty craft beer, as dark in color as the days ahead.
A flavorful and filling ale brewed by monks in Belgium.  Best served in a goblet.

A very flavorful beer that has been aged in bourbon barrels.  It is as black as midnight on a moonless night and has the viscosity of oil.  While very tasty, it also has an alcohol content on the level with wine.

name: tea
description: Tea, the beverage of gentlemen everywhere.
Coffee.  The morning ritual of the pre-apocalyptic world.

This serving of coffee has been created using an atomic coffee pot's FULL NUCLEAR brewing cycle.  Every possible microgram of caffeine and flavor has been carefully extracted for your enjoyment, using the power of the atom.

name: chocolate drink
description: A chocolate flavored beverage made of artificial flavoring and milk byproducts.  Shelf stable and vaguely appetizing even when lukewarm.
Blood, possibly that of a human.  Disgusting!
A healthy beverage made from dandelion roots steeped in boiling water.

name: tainted tallow
description: A smooth grayish block of cleaned and rendered monster fat.  It will remain 'fresh' for a very long time, and can be used as an ingredient in many projects.  You could eat it, but it will poison you.

name: blob glob
description: A little hunk of glop that fell off a blob monster.  It doesn't seem hostile, but it does wiggle occasionally.

name: irradiated apple
description: Mmm, irradiated.  Will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated banana
description: An irradiated banana will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated orange
description: An irradiated orange will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated lemon
description: An irradiated lemon will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
Dried kernels from a particular type of corn.  Practically inedible raw, they can be cooked to make a tasty snack.
An irradiated blueberry will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated strawberry will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
Raw wheat, not very tasty.
Seeds from a wild buckwheat plant.  Not particularly good to eat in their raw state, they are commonly cooked or ground into flour.
A cluster of small cone-like flowers, indispensable for brewing beer.

name: barley
description: Grainy cereal used for malting.  A staple of brewing everywhere.  It can also be ground into flour.

name: irradiated lettuce
description: An irradiated head of lettuce will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated cabbage
description: An irradiated head of cabbage will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated tomato will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated cluster of broccoli will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated zucchini
description: An irradiated zucchini will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated onion
description: An irradiated onion will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated carrot
description: An irradiated bundle of carrots will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated ear of corn will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

//: Just to illustrate something here.  Honey is one of the few items that so thoroughly earns the distinction of being called non-perishable that edible examples have been found that are centuries old.  And yet I'm taking no chances with this.
name: honey comb
description: A large chunk of wax filled with honey.  Very tasty.
A large chunk of beeswax.  Not very tasty or nourishing, but okay in an emergency.
A translucent hexagonal chunk of wax, filled with dense, milky jelly.  Delicious, and rich with the most beneficial substances the hive can produce, it is useful for curing all sorts of afflictions.
Raw oats.
Sweet, sweet sugar.  Bad for your teeth and surprisingly not very tasty on its own.

name: yeast
description: A powder-like mix of cultured yeast, good for baking and brewing alike.

name: bone meal
description: This bone meal can be used to craft fertilizer and some other things.

name: tainted bone meal
description: This is a grayish bone meal made from rotten bones.
This chitin powder can be used to craft fertilizer and some other things.
A tasty collection of wild herbs including violet, sassafras, mint, clover, purslane, fireweed, and burdock.
A healthy beverage made from herbs steeped in boiling water.
A fragrant and healthy beverage made from pine needles steeped in boiling water.
Whole fresh eggs, dehydrated into an easy to store powder.

name: irradiated pumpkin
description: An irradiated pumpkin will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
A water and sugar solution that has been extracted from a maple tree.
Sweet and delicious, real Vermont maple syrup.
A thick syrup produced from shredded sugar beets.  Useful in cooking as a sweetener.
Dried leaves of a tropical plant.  You can boil them into tea, or you can just eat them raw.  They aren't too filling though.
Ground coffee beans.  You can boil it into a mediocre stimulant, or swallow it raw for a lesser stimulative boost.
Dehydrated milk powder.  Mix with water to make drinkable milk.
A thick syrup made of water and sugar strained through coffee grounds.  Can be used to flavor many foods and beverages.
Honey, that stuff bees make.  This one is "forest honey", a liquid form of honey.  This honey won't spoil and is good for your digestion.
Honey, that stuff the bees make.  This variant is "candied honey", a variant of very thick consistence.  This honey won't spoil and is good for your digestion.

//: Why in the name of Armok, god of blood, is this even a comestible in the first place?
name: paper
description: A piece of paper.  Can be used for fires.

name: strawberry surprise
description: Strawberries left to ferment with a few other choice ingredients offer up a surprisingly palatable mixture; you barely even have to force yourself to drink it after the first few gulps.
This fermented blueberry mixture is surprisingly hearty, though the soup-like consistency is slightly unsettling no matter how much you drink.

name: tainted tornado
description: A frothing slurry of alcohol-soaked zombie flesh and rotten blood, it smells almost as bad as it looks.  Has weak mutagenic properties.
Shockingly tart white vinegar.
Thin yellow vegetable oil used for cooking.

name: irradiated pear
description: An irradiated pear will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
Some coffee beans, can be roasted.
Some roasted coffee beans, can be ground into powder.
An irradiated cherry will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated plum
description: A group of irradiated plums will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated grape will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated pineapple
description: An irradiated pineapple will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated peach will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated cranberry will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
Tangy yellow powder that smells strongly of lemons.  Can be mixed with water to make lemonade.

name: irradiated watermelon
description: An irradiated watermelon will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated melon
description: An irradiated melon will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated raspberry will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An irradiated blackberry will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
An extremely sugary tar-like syrup, with a slightly bitter aftertaste.

name: irradiated mango
description: An irradiated mango will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated pomegranate
description: An irradiated pomegranate will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated rhubarb
description: An irradiated rhubarb will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated papaya
description: An irradiated papaya will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated kiwi
description: An irradiated kiwi will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.

name: irradiated apricot
description: An irradiated apricot will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
Only the finest whiskey straight from the bung.

name: irradiated celery
description: An irradiated cluster of celery will remain edible nearly forever.  Sterilized using radiation, so it's safe to eat.
Salty fermented soybean sauce.
A spicy grated root vegetable packed in vinegared brine.
Some caramel.  Still bad for your health.

name: sewer brew
description: A thirsty mutant's drink of choice.  It tastes horrible but it's probably a lot safer to drink than before.

name: bark tea
description: Often regarded as folk medicine in some countries, bark tea tastes awful and tends to dry you out, but can help flush out stomach or other gut bugs.

name: honeygold brew
description: A mixed drink containing all the advantages of its ingredients and none of their disadvantages.  It tastes great and it's a good source of nourishment.

name: honey ball
description: Droplet shaped ant food.  It's like a thick balloon the size of a baseball, filled with sticky liquid.  Unlike bee honey, this has mostly a sour taste, probably because ants feed upon a variety of things.

name: thyme
description: A stalk of thyme.  Smells delicious.

name: canola
description: A pretty stalk of canola.  Its seeds can be pressed into oil.

name: dogbane
description: A stalk of dogbane.  It has very fibrous stems and is mildly poisonous.

name: bee balm
description: A snow-white flower also known as wild bergamot.  Smells faintly of mint.

name: spiked eggnog
description: Smooth and rich, this spoon-coating mixture of milk, cream, eggs, and booze is a popular traditional holiday drink.  Having been fortified with alcohol, it will keep for a long time.
